intro: Quetzalia standleyi, commonly known as the Mexican quetzal tree, is a species of flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango trees. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. Quetzalia standleyi is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural and ecological studies.
